report_source_files: US News & World Report 2026 Best Colleges
University of San Francisco Admissions Portal

strategic_profile.executive_summary: The University of San Francisco is a private Jesuit institution located in the heart of the city, known for its commitment to social justice, 'cura personalis' (care for the whole person), and a diverse student body.

analyst_takeaways.insight: Acceptance rates have tightened significantly, moving from roughly 70% to approximately 51% in recent cycles due to record application volumes.
analyst_takeaways.implication: Applicants should focus heavily on the personal essay to demonstrate alignment with Jesuit values to stand out in a growing pool.

analyst_takeaways.insight: The university remains firmly committed to a test-optional policy initiated in 2020.
analyst_takeaways.implication: Strong GPA and extracurricular leadership are now the primary determinants of admission success.

campus_dynamics.social_environment: Urban-integrated and socially conscious; social life is often decentralized, with students utilizing the entire city of San Francisco as their campus rather than relying on traditional Greek life or on-campus parties.
campus_dynamics.transportation_impact: High student mobility due to the 'Muni' pass included in tuition, which grants unlimited access to city buses and light rail, reducing the need for cars and extending the social scene across the Bay Area.
campus_dynamics.research_impact: Strong focus on undergraduate research and fabrication through 'The Innovation Hive' and specialized centers like the Jesuit Foundation, emphasizing projects with tangible social or community benefits.

admissions_trends.notes: Selectivity remained consistent with historical averages despite a slight decline in yield.
Marked increase in waitlist pool size compared to previous years.
Waitlist activity was exceptionally low with only a 3.7% admit rate.
Waitlist usage peaked significantly in 2020 due to pandemic-related enrollment uncertainty.

gpa.notes: Average high school GPA is 3.62 (unweighted). Approximately 45% of admitted students possess a GPA of 3.75 or higher.

testing.policy_note: Test optional. Standardized test scores are considered if submitted but are not required for admission or merit scholarship consideration.

non_binary.note: Reported as 'Another Gender' in 2024 CDS/IPEDS reporting.

colleges.name: College of Arts and Sciences
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Focus your application on the 'Cura Personalis' (care for the whole person) philosophy. Demonstrate a commitment to social justice and community engagement, as USF values students who aim to 'Change the World from Here.' For Engineering applicants, ensure high proficiency in Mathematics, specifically through Precalculus or higher.
colleges.housing_profile: Traditional residence halls featuring robust Living-Learning Communities (LLCs) such as the St. Ignatius Institute (spiritual exploration) and the Marshall-Riley LLC (Black American history and intellectual tradition).
colleges.student_archetype: The Socially Conscious Scholar: Intellectually curious students who are deeply engaged in activism, diverse cultural exchange, and interdisciplinary research.

majors.name: Psychology
majors.notes: One of the most popular majors; features a research-heavy foundational core.

majors.name: Biology
majors.notes: Strongly prepares students for medical/dental school; strict grade repeat policy.

majors.name: Computer Science
majors.notes: Located in a tech hub with high emphasis on project-based learning and AI integration.

majors.name: Engineering
majors.notes: A relatively new, project-based program seeking ABET accreditation.

majors.name: Economics
majors.notes: Heavily analytical; offers 4+1 accelerated Master's pathways.

majors.name: Kinesiology
majors.notes: Highly integrated with Pre-Health advising for Physical Therapy pathways.

colleges.name: School of Management
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Highlight entrepreneurial initiative and a 'business for good' mindset. USF Management seeks students who want to leverage San Francisco's tech and finance hubs to build ethical, purpose-driven enterprises.
colleges.housing_profile: Students often reside in first-year halls like Hayes-Healy or Gillson, with access to professional-themed LLCs that facilitate networking and site visits to Bay Area companies.
colleges.student_archetype: The Purpose-Driven Entrepreneur: Ambitious, networking-savvy students who view business as a tool for creating equitable global change.

majors.name: Management
majors.notes: The primary business major; accredited by AACSB.

majors.name: Management (BAM)
majors.notes: Adult degree completion program; requires 60 prior units.

colleges.name: School of Nursing and Health Professions
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Extremely selective. Applicants must complete Chemistry in high school and demonstrate a high GPA (typically 4.0+). Note that USF does not allow students admitted to other majors to transfer into the Nursing program later; you must be admitted directly as a first-year.
colleges.housing_profile: Heavily integrated into LLCs in Toler Hall, where students take common courses and participate in clinical prep workshops together.
colleges.student_archetype: The Compassionate Professional: High-achieving, disciplined students with a profound commitment to healthcare equity and hands-on clinical service.

majors.name: Nursing
majors.notes: Extremely competitive. If you are admitted to USF for any other major, you cannot switch into Nursing later.

majors.name: Public Health
majors.notes: Often chosen by students interested in health policy or administration.

colleges.name: School of Education
colleges.strategic_fit_advice: Best fit for students pursuing the Dual Degree in Teacher Preparation. Emphasize experience in tutoring, youth mentorship, or educational advocacy in urban settings.
colleges.housing_profile: Primarily shares housing with the College of Arts and Sciences, often utilizing Nagle Hall due to its proximity to the Education building.
colleges.student_archetype: The Future Educator: Empathic leaders dedicated to transformative pedagogy and social equity within the classroom.

minors_certificates: Jewish Studies and Social Justice Minor
Public Service and Community Engagement Minor

application_deadlines.notes: Regular decision deadline for spring term.

supplemental_requirements.details: USF does not require a supplemental essay for most majors beyond the Common App personal statement.
One required 200-word response: 'What will be your responsibility to others as a Jesuit-educated, BSN professional registered nurse?'
Additional short answer questions required for applicants to this specific program.

holistic_factors.specific_differentiators: Emphasis on 'cura personalis' (care for the whole person) and the Jesuit mission of social justice and community service.

major_selection_tactics: Avoid the Nursing major unless you are certain and have a 3.9+ GPA; it is direct-entry only with a strict no-internal-transfer policy.
Apply to the College of Arts and Sciences as 'Undeclared' to maximize general admission odds if stats are borderline.
Incorporate the Jesuit value of 'Cura Personalis' (care for the whole person) into your supplemental essay.
Check specific math prerequisites for the School of Engineering; applicants without Precalculus are often redirected.
Consider the Sacramento campus for Nursing if open to living outside of SF.
application_strategy.alternate_major_strategy: If applying to the highly selective Nursing program, list Kinesiology or Public Health as your alternate major. For Computer Science applicants, selecting Data Science or Mathematics as an alternate is recommended.

scholarships.name: University Scholarship
scholarships.benefits: Renewable for four years; applies to tuition only

scholarships.name: Presidential Scholarship
scholarships.benefits: Awarded to high-achieving first-year students; renewable based on GPA

scholarships.name: Black Scholars Program (Full-Tuition)
scholarships.benefits: Mentorship, community leadership training, and full tuition coverage

scholarships.name: Charles E. Cross Award
scholarships.benefits: Exclusively for graduates of Catholic or Jesuit high schools

scholarships.name: Araoz Nursing Scholarship
scholarships.benefits: Dedicated to students admitted to the Hilltop first-year nursing program

scholarships.name: University Tuition Grant
scholarships.benefits: Helps bridge the gap between merit aid and the full cost of tuition

ap_policy.general_rule: Scores of 3 or higher grant credit for most exams
exceptions: Score of 4 or higher required for English Language, Calculus, Biology, Chemistry, US History, European History, and World History
Biology major credit for BIOL 105/106 requires a score of 5 and departmental petition
ap_policy.usage: Satisfies USF Core Curriculum (GE) requirements and some major prerequisites

ib_policy.general_rule: 10 semester units awarded for each Higher Level (HL) exam with a score of 4 or higher
ib_policy.usage: Credits apply toward core requirements and elective units; no credit is awarded for Standard Level (SL) exams

transfer_articulation.restrictions: 44-unit residency requirement (minimum of 44 units must be completed at USF); residency requirement limits total transferable units to roughly 84 out of 128

what_it_takes: A strong academic record in college-prep courses (4 years English, 3 years Math/Social Science)
Specific prerequisites: Precalculus for Engineering and Chemistry for Nursing applicants
Evidence of self-reflection and a commitment to 'cura personalis' (care for the whole person)
Alignment with Jesuit values of social justice and community responsibility
Competitive GPA (middle 50% often falls in the 3.61 unweighted range)
common_activities: Community service projects focused on urban social issues
Clinical or volunteer experience (highly prioritized for Nursing and Pre-med tracks)
Leadership in identity-based or cultural student organizations
Internships leveraging the San Francisco/Bay Area tech and business ecosystem
essay_tips: Explicitly connect your personal goals to USF’s mission of 'changing the world from here'
Emphasize diversity and how your unique background contributes to the campus community
Focus on quality over quantity in the extracurricular prompt; deep commitment to one area is preferred
Show self-awareness by discussing a specific moment of growth or a challenge you've overcome
red_flags: Describing USF as a 'safety school' in communication or essays
Generic essays that fail to mention the school’s specific Jesuit identity or SF location
Lack of rigor in core STEM subjects for students applying to Nursing or Engineering
Treating community service as a checkbox rather than a genuine interest
insights: The campus culture is described as 'mature' and integrated into the city; don't expect a secluded 'college town' feel
Financial aid can be a major hurdle; tuition is high and living in San Francisco adds significant cost
Small class sizes foster very close relationships with professors
For Pre-meds, the proximity to UCSF provides clinical opportunities that are less competitive than at larger publics
